result.execSummary:
The defendant Carlos Aguilar was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Unknown statute], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Criminal Damage to Property [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse, Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Carlos Aguilar

records.addlTxt: 10:00 AM Defendant Carlos Aguilar in court.  Attorney Robert S. Duxstad in court for Carlos Aguilar.  Attorney Laura Kohl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advises defendant of rights. Elements stated.  Factual basis found. Plea Questionnaire filed and reviewed. The defendant enters a plea of No Contest to counts 1,2 and 3. The Court finds the defendant Guilty of all three counts. The factual basis is outlined in the criminal complaint. ADA Kohl requests the Court to impose a sentence of 3 years of probation, with AODA, Anger Management or Domestic Violence counseling, pay all costs of this action and to comply and complete with any other treatment and or counseling their agent deems appropriate. Attorney Duxstad requests that The Court imposes a small fine for each count including court costs. The Court imposes a withheld sentence as probation for a period of 2 years on each of the three counts with the conditions being AODA, Defendant shall cooperate with, participate in, and successfully complete evaluations, treatment and Anger Management and Domestic Violence and any other counseling deemed appropriate by Agent, and the defendant is to pay all court costs and probation costs on this action. Defendant advised of post conviction relief.

10:02 AM Carlos Aguilar, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Robert S. Duxstad. Laura Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. Officer Brian Bennett sworn on oath & testifies under direct and cross.  Witness identifies the defendant. Witness excused.  The court does not find Probable Cause. Count #4 is not bound over. State requests a transcript and will be filing a Motion to reconsider by April 11, 2022. Defense cousel to respond by May 9, 2022. Bond continues. Matter set over. Carlos Aguilar, defendant appeared in Court in person with counsel Robert Duxstad. Laura Kohl appeared as prosecuting attorney. Court advises defendant of rights. Defendant given complaint. Court advises defendant of charges and penalties.
Defendant given complaint.

May not possess or consume any intoxicants.  No violent or abusive contact with: M.G.I.A.  May not enter establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold. Violations: Battery(DV); Disorderly Conduct (DV); Criminal Damage to Property (DV); False Imprisonment (DV). Iss. Agency: Brodhead Police Dept.
